etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in John Lawson (d. 1711), surveyor

definitions: New Jersey tea, Ceanothus americanus (family Rhamnaceae); (also, with distinguishing word) any of the other shrubs of this genus.
A swamp plant, Lachnanthes caroliniana (family Haemodoraceae), with hairy yellow flowers, also called paint-root.
(More fully "redroot pigweed") a kind of amaranth, Amaranthus retroflexus.
